get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all active players.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full team information: team name and city, league and division, colors, and coaching. Also contains basic fantasy info such as IDs as well as full stadium data. This endpoint returns all teams regardless of current active status.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full statistical information for a specified game, down to the team and player stat level, delivered live during the game, called per individual game.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameid
parameters.description: The GameID of an CBB game. GameIDs can be found in the Games API. Valid entries are 14620 or 16905

get.description: Full statistical information for games, down to the team and player stat level, delivered live during the game, called for a given date (returns all games on that date.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

get.description: This method returns all box scores for a given season and week, but only returns player stats that have changed in the last X minutes as specified in your API call. By definition this is a live endpoint, not final.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

parameters.name: minutes
parameters.description: Only returns player statistics that have changed in the last X minutes. You specify how many minutes in time to go back. Valid entries are: 1 or 2.

get.description: Full scores and gameday info delivered live and post-game. Live data includes innings and score info. Gameday info includes weather, TV channel etc.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

get.description: Home and away teams, date and time, season type and week etc. are included. Also includes gameday information. This includes full stadium information (capacity, lat/long, roof status etc.), top-line betting information (spread, moneyline, total), weather conditions, and broadcast information.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018PRE, 2018POST, 2018STAR, 2019, etc.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record for all involved players across a given date, updated live as the game takes place.
get.summary: Player Game Stats - by Date [Live & Final]

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

get.description: Returns all season-long stats (i.e. the season total, not each individual game record) for all players for a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018POST, 2019.

get.description: Returns all season-long stats (i.e. the season total, not each individual game record) for a given team's players in a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018POST, 2019.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested team.
Examples: SF, NYY.

get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all available players by team.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested team.
Examples: SF, NYY.

get.description: SportsDataIO's proprietary projections, including DFS salary information and injuries, for fantasy players, called by date.
get.summary: Projected Player Game Stats - by Date

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record team-wide (aggregated from all players) for a given team's game in a given week, both live and post-game.
get.summary: Team Game Stats - by Date [Live & Final]

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

get.description: Returns all season-long stats (i.e. the season total, not each individual game record) for all teams (aggregated from all players) for a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018POST, 2019.

get.description: Returns true if there is at least one game being played at the time of the request or false if there are none.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Player Season Stats - by Player

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018POST, 2019.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:60003802.

get.description: Player Details - by Player

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:60003802.

get.description: Year of the current season. This value changes at the start of the new league year.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Player Game Stats - by Player

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:60003802.

get.description: Projected Player Game Stats - by Player
get.summary: Projected Player Game Stats - by Player

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:60003802.

get.description: Returns all  conferences with their respective teams and current season record.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full scores and gameday info delivered live and post-game. Live data includes half and score info. Gameday info includes weather, TV channel etc

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018POST, 2019.

get.description: Returns all stadiums in CBB with capacity, surface, latitude/longitude, city and state (and where applicable country.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Specify a season, a player, and number of games (either an integer or all) to see all of their box score logs. Refreshed after their most recent game is complete.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description: Season to get games from. Example 2019POST, 2020

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID.Example:60008094.

parameters.name: numberofgames
parameters.description: How many games to return. Example all, 10, 25

get.description: Game-by-game log of total team statistics for a given season, split up by game (not aggregated into season totals.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description: Season to get games from. Example 2019POST, 2020

parameters.name: teamid
parameters.description: Unique ID of team. Example 1

parameters.name: numberofgames
parameters.description: How many games to return. Example all, 10, 25

get.description: This endpoint provides all currently injured college basketball players, along with injury details.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full statistical information for a specified game, down to the team and player stat level, delivered after the game is complete.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameid
parameters.description: The GameID of an CBB game. GameIDs can be found in the Games API. Valid entries are 14620 or 16905

get.description: Full statistical information for all games on a given date, down to the team and player stat level, delivered after the game is complete.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record team-wide (aggregated from all players) for all games on a given date, updated as each game concludes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record for all involved players across all teams' games on a given date. After each game has concluded its players' records are added.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.
